_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Introduction and Policies

Employees who enter the Sherman Gas Plant complete a  training program  that enables them to address emergency issues as they arise. This preparation includes standard operational, emergency operational and release prevention training. In addition, periodic refresher courses help to keep operators? problem solving abilities up-to-date and in sync with our recurring safety improvements.

Description of Plant

Sherman Gas Plant is an unmanned natural gas liquid (NGL) extraction facility, with local sales of NGL from a pressurized storage tank. The facility consists of an NGL extraction plant, sales of natural gas to a pipeline system and sales of NGL locally. There are no toxic substances at the plant in quantities above the regulated threshold quantity. The facility is classified as a Program Level 2 under the RMP regulations since the facility is not subject to PSM regulations (due to being unmanned). The purpose of this Risk Management Plan is to provide information about the operations at the facility, the programs to prevent accidental chemical releases, the emergency response plan, the five year accident history at the facility and our planned changes to improve safety at the facility.

Prevention Program

The Sherman Gas Plant complies with EPA?s accidental release prevention rule and applicable state and local codes. The facility maintains safety information on the facility at the facility and at the company offices. The facility was constructed according to good engineering practices. A hazard review will be performed in the near future. A previous hazard review was performed during construction/startup of the facility. The hazard review shall meet the requirements for Program Level 2 facilities. There are  operating procedures for the equipment at the facility. Employees at the facility are trained prior to starting work at the facility to ensure that they are able to safely operate the facility and safely react

to any emergency. Their training primarily consists of work-related experience and on-the-job training. The facility maintains the equipment at the facility according to current industry standards.  Any incidents at the site will be investigated thoroughly, with findings reported to all employees.

Five Year Accident History

There have been no incidents at the Sherman Gas Plant over the past five (5) years.

Emergency Response Program

The Sherman Gas Plant has an emergency response plan that has been coordinated with the local emergency response personnel.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

There are currently no planned changes.
